page.title: 04HOUSES IN GREAT EASTON
page.content: Great Easton is made up of old and new houses .Many of the older houses were built around 135 years ago which was when the Maynard Estate was built.The Maynard family of Easton Lodge owned most of the land around the area.They are red brick houses. There are 89 houses in Great Easton;34 detached,40 semi-detached,6 terrace and 9 bungalows. The oldest house belongs to Mary Blakey.It is at the bottom of the hill and is 600 years old.It has a wooden frame with plaster.It has two rooms either side up and down.In the middle it had a central hall which was open to the roof.Now there is a floor there to make a master bedroom above. Opposite the church there is a flint cottage which was built in 1822. It has a quern,over the door,to keep out witches.
